thread.title: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck reveals why he won't play FA Cup tie vs Sutton United | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck reveals why he won't play FA Cup tie vs Sutton United | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Danny Welbeck reveals why he won't play FA Cup tie vs Sutton United | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 2:35 pm Danny Welbeck admits he will not play against Sutton due to their plastic pitch. (Getty Images) 
Danny Welbeck has revealed that he will miss Arsenal’s FA Cup tie with Sutton United because the game is being played on a plastic pitch. 
The 26-year-old has suffered two serious knee injuries in the past 20 months and only made his first-team return last month. 
Welbeck was a surprise inclusion for Arsenal Under-23s’ clash with Leicester City on Sunday afternoon and played 70 minutes as the Gunners fell to a 2-1 defeat. 
And after the match, the England international revealed that he will not be facing the non-league side due to their artificial surface. Glad to get 70 minutes today to build up my match fitness. Plastic pitch at Sutton isn't the best idea at the moment. #COYG 
— Danny Welbeck (@DannyWelbeck) February 19, 2017 
Welbeck hasn’t started a game for Arsenal since he scored twice in the 5-0 win over Southampton in the last round of the FA Cup and was an unused substitute in the 5-1 loss to Bayern Munich on Wednesday evening. 
Last month, Arsene Wenger admitted he needed to be cautious over Welbeck’s injury. 
‘Danny’s very sharp but we’re still not out of it completely,’ said the Arsenal manager.
